Class for /table responses

Source: R/table.R
sc_table_class.Rd

R6 Class for all responses of the /table endpoint of the STATcube REST API.

Super class

STATcubeR::sc_data -> sc_table

Active bindings

response

the httr response

raw

the raw response content

annotation_legend

list of all annotations occuring in the data

rate_limit

how much requests were left after the POST request for this table was sent?

json

an object of class sc_json based the json file used in the request

Methods

Public methods

  • sc_table_class$new()

  • sc_table_class$update()

  • sc_table_class$tabulate()

  • sc_table_class$browse()

Inherited methods

  • STATcubeR::sc_data$field()

  • STATcubeR::sc_data$total_codes()

Method new()

Ususally, objects of class sc_table are generated with one of the factory methods sc_table(), sc_table_saved() or sc_table_custom(). If this constructor is invoked directly, either omit the parameters json and file or make sure that they match with response.

Usage

sc_table_class$new(response, json = NULL, file = NULL)

Arguments

response

a response from httr::POST() against the /table endpoint.

json

the json file used in the request as a string.

file

the file path to the json file

Method update()

Update the data by re-sending the json to the API. This is still experimental and could break the object in case new levels were added to one of the fields. For example, if a new entry is added to a timeseries

Usage

sc_table_class$update()

Method tabulate()

An extension of sc_data$tabulate() with additional parameters.

Usage

sc_table_class$tabulate(..., round = TRUE, annotations = FALSE)

Arguments

...

Parameters which are passed down to sc_data$tabulate()

round

apply rounding to each measure accoring to the precision provided by the API.

annotations

Include separate annotation columns in the returned table. See sc_tabulate()

Method browse()

open the dataset in a browser

Usage

sc_table_class$browse()

Contents
